net.centro.rtb.http

Class HttpConnectorBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.centro.rtb.http.HttpConnectorBuilder

  • public class HttpConnectorBuilder
extends Object
    This starting point for creating a new http connection.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ofir Gal

        - Builder Ojbect

      • url

        public HttpConnectorBuilder url(String urlString)
                         throws URISyntaxException
        The simplest, most commonly used method to set the destination URL.
        Parameters:
        urlString - (Ex. http://ofirgal.com)
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException

      • url

        public HttpConnectorBuilder url(Http.HttpProtocol protocol,
                                String domain,
                                int port,
                                String path)
                         throws URISyntaxException
        An optional way to set a url.
        Parameters:
        protocol - HTTP/HTTPS
        domain - Domain we are connecting to
        port - On which port we are connecting on
        path - url path appended to the end of domain and port
        Returns:
        Builder
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException

      • setBody

        public <E> HttpConnectorBuilder setBody(E body)
        Sets the body of the request.

      • async

        public HttpConnectorBuilder async()
        Sets the request to async. The HttpConnector.execute() will finish before a response returns.

      • async

        public HttpConnectorBuilder async(javax.ws.rs.client.InvocationCallback invocationCallback)
        Implement the InvocationCallback interface to define the handling of the response. Ideal, clean and efficient way for optimized async processing.
        Parameters:
        invocationCallback - javax.ws.rs.client.InvocationCallback.

      • storeCookies

        public HttpConnectorBuilder storeCookies()
        (optional) Sets the request to store any set cookies associated with the response. Should only be used if needed, as it will have a performance impact on async requests.

      • setClientProperties

        public HttpConnectorBuilder setClientProperties(Map<String,Object> properties)
        (optional) Created to allow greater control, but not required for the common usage.
        Parameters:
        properties - keys and values should follow org.glassfish.jersey.client.ClientProperties

      • setAsyncThreadPoolSize

        public HttpConnectorBuilder setAsyncThreadPoolSize(int numberOfThreads)
        (optional) Sets the thread pool size for async calls. Default is set to 100 threads.

      • compress

        public HttpConnectorBuilder compress(Http.Encoding encoding)
        Set the compression method for the HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        encoding - encoding enum.

      • trustAllSslContext

        public HttpConnectorBuilder trustAllSslContext()
        (optional) Made with testing in mind. When you want to make HTTPS connection without validating SSL certificates. Ideal for testing, risky for production.

      • build

        public HttpConnector build()
        Builds the HttpConnector object. Make this call as the final step of your builder.
        Returns:
        a new HttpConnector object
